Key Arguments: The legislation is seen as a form of censorship similar to that used in communist countries.
Freedom of speech and thought are fundamental rights that should not be restricted.
The ability to question government decisions is essential for a healthy democracy.
The proposed oversight by a government department or committee is viewed as an infringement on personal freedoms.
There is skepticism about who decides what constitutes misinformation or disinformation.
Notable Quotes: Censorship is a tool used by communist countries such as China and North Korea and has never been acceptable in free nations such as ours.
Meaningful debate and questioning of decisions made by those in power, is what made our nation great.
Leave our freedoms alone, and do not pass this bill.
